etymologies: late 19th century: from the verb jig + the noun saw

definitions: a puzzle consisting of a picture printed on cardboard or wood and cut into various pieces of different shapes that have to be fitted together

examples.text: time is passed by doing jigsaws

shortDefinitions: puzzle consisting of picture printed on cardboard or wood and cut into various pieces of different shapes

definitions: a mystery that can only be resolved by assembling various pieces of information

examples.text: help the police put all the pieces of the jigsaw together

shortDefinitions: mystery that can only be resolved by assembling various pieces of information

definitions: a machine saw with a fine blade enabling it to cut curved lines in a sheet of wood, metal, or plastic.
shortDefinitions: machine saw with fine blade enabling it to cut curved lines in sheet of wood or plastic
